body_html:
In case this helps anybody else: our crashing issue mentioned immediately above seems to have been power-related. NVIDIA GPUs will actually happily "overshoot" their claimed power limit, sometimes by a lot, and when they do that simultaneously against a power supply that's too close to its specified max, a brownout can occur and the system can crash.

The "temporary" fix (or a hypothesis test, at least) for this is to add:

nvidia-smi -pm 1
nvidia-smi -pl 200

to rc.local. This will reduce Pmax of 1080ti's by about 20%. Moral of the story: get a 1500-1600W power supply for your quad-GPU box, 1300W is not enough.

NVIDIA GPUs will actually happily "overshoot" their claimed power limit, sometimes by a lot, and when they do that simultaneously against a power supply that's too close to its specified max, a brownout can occur and the system can crash. 

The "temporary" fix (or a hypothesis test, at least) for this is to add:
```
nvidia-smi -pm 1
nvidia-smi -pl 200
```
to `rc.local`. This will reduce P<sub>max</sub> of 1080ti's by about 20%. Moral of the story: get a 1500-1600W power supply for your quad-GPU box, 1300W is not enough.
